triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: SCIP is built on the constraint integer programming framework for mathematical optimization.

triples.name: Branch and bound
triples.relevance: SCIP uses branch-and-bound algorithms to solve optimization problems by breaking them into subproblems.

triples.name: Cutting-plane method
triples.relevance: SCIP 9.0 introduces new cut generators and cut selection schemes based on cutting plane methods.

triples.name: Heuristic (computer science)
triples.relevance: SCIP 9.0 adds new and improved primal heuristics to find good solutions quickly.

triples.name: Nonlinear programming
triples.relevance: SCIP 9.0 includes additions and improvements to nonlinear handlers for solving nonlinear constraints.

triples.name: Linear programming
triples.relevance: SCIP relies on linear programming solvers like SoPlex as part of its optimization framework.

triples.name: Mathematical optimization
triples.relevance: The SCIP Optimization Suite provides a collection of software packages for mathematical optimization.

triples.name: Symmetry group
triples.relevance: SCIP 9.0 features improved symmetry handling in its optimization framework.

triples.name: Parallel algorithm
triples.relevance: The UG parallel framework in SCIP 9.0 enables parallel algorithm execution for solving problems faster.
